page.title: 15BEE KEEPING IN COOKSBRIDGE
page.content: {The countryside around Cooksbridge, {Hamsey and Offham is very good for {bee-keeping. This is because}there are few people but many wild flowers in the hedgerows as well as flowering trees and cultivated flowers in the many large gardens and country estates. In addition crops such as oil seed rape and beans which are good for bees are popular with farmers in this area.{ {Mr.Stephen Kelly}is one of several local bee keepers. He has 7 hives containing 250 000 bees. He used to keep all his bees at Cooksbridge but some of them were particularly vicious so he had to take them further away from houses. Mr. Kelly produced{40kg of honey in {1984 from each hive}which he sold for {Â£2 a kg.}He akso sells the wax for furniture polish.
